faqs.question: What is the complete admission process at the University of Sindh?
faqs.answer: The admission process includes online registration, filling the online admission form, paying the processing fee, uploading documents, appearing in the pre-entry test, merit list announcement, fee submission, and final confirmation.

faqs.question: Where do I apply for Sindh University admission?
faqs.answer: You can apply online through the official admission portal at admission.usindh.edu.pk.

faqs.question: What documents are required for admission?
faqs.answer: You need attested SSC and HSSC certificates, CNIC or B-Form, domicile, passport size photographs, entry test result, and equivalence certificate for O/A Level students.

faqs.question: Can I apply without my own CNIC or B-Form?
faqs.answer: Yes, if you do not have your own CNIC or B-Form, you can use your guardian or father’s CNIC in special cases.

faqs.question: What seat categories are available at Sindh University?
faqs.answer: Admissions are offered in three categories: Merit (Morning), Self Finance (Evening), and Super Self.

faqs.question: What is Super Self admission?
faqs.answer: Super Self students study in the morning with merit students but pay higher fees.

faqs.question: How many merit lists are announced every year?
faqs.answer: Multiple merit lists are announced every year depending on available seats.

faqs.question: When is the first merit list announced?
faqs.answer: The first merit list is usually announced in late November or early December.

faqs.question: When are other merit lists announced?
faqs.answer: Second merit list is usually announced in late December, while third, fourth, and fifth lists are announced from January to February.

faqs.question: How is merit calculated?
faqs.answer: Merit is calculated on the basis of Combined Percentage Number (CPN).

faqs.question: When is the Sindh University entry test held?
faqs.answer: The entry test is conducted in October in two phases during the first and second weeks.

faqs.question: What are the passing marks for the entry test?
faqs.answer: The passing percentage is usually 30 percent, but it may increase or decrease depending on results.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for BS programs?
faqs.answer: Students who have completed Intermediate (12 years education), including Pre-Engineering and Pre-Medical, are eligible.

faqs.question: Does Sindh University offer Master’s programs?
faqs.answer: Yes, Sindh University offers Master’s programs. Eligibility depends on marks and department rules.

faqs.question: How many departments does Sindh University have?
faqs.answer: Sindh University has more than 60 departments across different faculties.

faqs.question: What degree programs are offered?
faqs.answer: Most programs are BS degrees. Only Electronics Engineering and Telecommunication Engineering offer BE degrees.

faqs.question: Is hostel facility available?
faqs.answer: Yes, Sindh University provides separate hostels for boys and girls on merit basis.

faqs.question: What documents are required for hostel allotment?
faqs.answer: Students must submit a hostel application form, CNIC or B-Form, and photographs.

faqs.question: What is the hostel fee?
faqs.answer: The annual hostel fee is approximately 10,000 PKR.

faqs.question: What hostel facilities are provided?
faqs.answer: Hostels provide rooms, washrooms, mosque, canteen, and basic living facilities.

faqs.question: What scholarships are available at Sindh University?
faqs.answer: Scholarships include HEC Need Based, Ehsaas, Merit-cum-Need, Minority Scholarship, and Laptop Schemes.

faqs.question: What are class timings for regular students?
faqs.answer: Regular and Super Self classes are held from 8:30 AM to 2:00 PM.

faqs.question: What are class timings for Self Finance students?
faqs.answer: Self Finance classes are held from 2:00 PM to 6:00 or 7:00 PM.

faqs.question: Is LAT or LET required for Law admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, passing LAT or LET with at least 50 marks is mandatory for Law admission.

faqs.question: Is an entry test required for Art and Design programs?
faqs.answer: Yes, a drawing and design based entry test is compulsory for Institute of Art and Design.

faqs.question: What semester system is followed?
faqs.answer: Sindh University follows a semester system with Odd and Even semesters.

faqs.question: When are semester exams conducted?
faqs.answer: Odd semester exams are held in May or June, and Even semester exams are held in December.

faqs.question: What are exam fees for improvement or failure?
faqs.answer: Exam fee is 1700 PKR per paper for Merit and Super Self students, and 2100 PKR for Self Finance students.

faqs.question: Can students appear in a different semester exam?
faqs.answer: No, Odd semester papers can only be attempted in Odd semesters and Even semester papers in Even semesters.

faqs.question: How can I apply for transcript?
faqs.answer: Students must apply at the Examination Department and submit transcript challan.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a degree certificate?
faqs.answer: Students must submit a degree challan and clearance certificates from hostel, department, and library.

faqs.question: What is the official examination website?
faqs.answer: The official examination website is exam.usindh.edu.pk.

faqs.question: When do new classes usually start?
faqs.answer: New batch classes usually start at the end of January or in the first week of February.

faqs.question: When was the University of Sindh established?
faqs.answer: The University of Sindh was established in April 1947.

faqs.question: Who was the first Vice Chancellor of Sindh University?
faqs.answer: The first Vice Chancellor was Allama I.I. Qazi.

faqs.question: What is the main administration building called?
faqs.answer: The main administration building of Sindh University is called the AC-2 Block.

faqs.question: What is Mehran University’s relation with Sindh University?
faqs.answer: Mehran University of Engineering and Technology was previously a college under Sindh University and later became a separate university.
